Yes, there are resources available to help OHL players balance their academic and athletic schedules. Each team has an education advisor who works with players to help them manage their time effectively and stay on track academically. Advisors provide academic support, study strategies, and time management tips to help players balance their academic responsibilities with their hockey obligations.

In addition, the OHL and its teams have partnered with various universities and colleges to provide players with access to educational resources and opportunities. Many OHL teams have agreements with local school boards to allow players to attend classes at a flexible schedule or to receive tutoring and support outside of regular school hours. The league and teams also offer financial support for players who wish to pursue post-secondary education or vocational training after their hockey careers.

Overall, the OHL and its teams are committed to helping players achieve academic success while developing their hockey skills. They recognize that education is an important part of players' long-term success and work hard to provide the resources and support needed to help players succeed both on and off the ice.
